column1: Table 3.9.5. Government Consumption Expenditures and Gross Investment
Last Revised on: February 28, 2019 - Next Release Date March 28, 2019

column2: Government consumption expenditures and gross investment

column1: 1. Government consumption expenditures are services (such as education and national defense) produced by government that are valued at their cost of production. Excludes government sales to other sectors and government own-account investment (construction, software, and research and development).
2. Gross government investment consists of general government and government enterprise expenditures for fixed assets; inventory investment is included in government consumption expenditures.
